alert.note: Alert for Anchorage; Matanuska Valley (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 02 at 5:58PM AKDT by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...AREAS OF FREEZING RAIN POSSIBLE FROM ANCHORAGE NORTH TO THE MATANUSKA VALLEY FRIDAY MORNING... The potential for patchy areas of light freezing rain (a 10 to 30 percent chance) could spill into Anchorage and portions of the Matanuska Valley early Friday morning. Air temperatures are expected to be between 30 and 36 degrees at the onset of precipitation. Even in areas where the air temperature is above freezing, ground temperatures near or below freezing will cause ice to form. The most likely areas for ice accumulation on roadways and/or freezing rain include: East Anchorage, the Glenn Highway Corridor from Muldoon north to the Palmer Hay Flats, and the Matanuska Valley from Meadow Lakes south to Pt. Mackenzie. Black ice may form in these areas, so plan accordingly and be sure to check the forecast for updates.
